data.title: Sharma on LinkedIn: Integreon is looking for a Business Analyst with strong experience in CLMâ€¦
data.meta_description: Integreon is looking for a Business Analyst with strong experience in CLM software (preferably with Sirion Labs) with one of the esteemed Financial Servicesâ€¦
data.text:
Hi, Business Analystâ€”Hybrid- Hanover MD 2 Days a Week Financial Domain Mandatory Please share the suitable resume to shalini@vstconsulting.com Top Skills' Details Requirements: 1) Interfacing with Stakeholders (Most Important) --> driving the discussion for solutions 2) Data/SQL --> Knowledge of data, databases, and basic SQL queries 3) API Integration experience required 4) Agile experience, Requirements Gathering and defining solutions 5) Nice to have: Scrum Master or Product Owner experience Secondary Skills - Nice to Haves Summary: The main function of a Business Systems Analyst is to perform the analysis, design, implementation, modification, and daily functional support of all applications. Job Responsibilities: â€¢ Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies â€¢ Gathers requirements from business units and translate those to programmers and developers â€¢ Prepares cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation â€¢ Demonstrates an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities â€¢ Supports one or more highly complex business processes â€¢ Works on multiple projects as a project team member â€¢ Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs Qualifications: â€¢ Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required. MBA or other related advanced degree preferred â€¢ 10+ yearsâ€™ experience required â€¢ Basic knowledge of programming languages in order to comprehend reading code and basic functions â€¢ Ability to create business solutions that increase competitive advantage â€¢ Ability to exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions â€¢ Project management skills in order to handle diverse projects, often times simultaneously, and meet aggressive deadlines â€¢ Ability to solve technical problems/ processes and understand complex details â€¢ Ability to increase operating efficiency with produce high quality technical solutions â€¢ A high level of interpersonal and verbal communication skills necessary to relate to other people at their systems knowledge level â€¢ Ability to analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to arrive at innovative solutions Additional Skills & Qualifications Financial experience is preferred so that the understanding of terms pre-exists. WE needs DRIVERS. Manager said that a good BA should be getting on her nerves by asking too many questions. Requirements â€¢ Extremely strong SQL & API skills as they will be in an extremely data-intensive environment â€¢ Excellent communication and problem-solving skills â€¢ ServiceNow is a plus, however it can easily be taught, and they are moving away from it

#hiring MS Application System Analyst IV, Baltimore, United States, fulltime #jobs #jobseekers #careers #Baltimorejobs #Marylandjobs #ITCommunications Apply: https://lnkd.in/gUuttaKQ Job Description General Summary Under minimal supervision gathers and analyzes user needs for developing and modifying clinical or business applications in the healthcare environment. Leads documentation, writing specifications, fact-finding, analyzing results, proposing solutions and/or recommendations, in addition to building, configuring and/or modifying applications using existing application tools. Principal Responsibilities and Tasks The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. These are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by personnel so classified. Leads highly complex analysis, design, development, testing and support services for assigned application applications. Responsible for and oversees day to day tracking and follow-up on issues and questions of daily operations. Validates testing results. Leads applications analysis and impact analysis of new or different applications, processes or changes. Provides highly complex application support and guidance to end users and provides technical guidance to less experienced personnel. Serves as point of contact for resolution of complex application problems. Able to quickly assess problems and identify resolutions. Leads development of application testing scripts and conversion plans. Participates in testing as assigned. Makes recommendations and provide alternatives with regards to various development and support initiatives. Prepares written documentation of various types; application documentation, analytical reports, functional specifications, training manuals, status reports, etc. Creates, evaluates and instructs/teaches other analysts. Participates and/or leads complex projects, estimates costs, time frames, staffing requirements and prepares cost justifications for assigned project. Uses status reports for project oversight. Leads the designing for each application assigned, under the control of the change management application and user development request. Prepares and validates complete applications documentation for operations and sets programming specifications for user departments. Assist in the development of departmental policies and procedures as they relate to the use of clinical applications.

Lead Business Analyst - (Candidates with 10+ years of experience) ONLY CONSIDERING Candidates Local to the DC, MD, VA and WV Immediate W2 requirement hr@lussotech.com Manager Notes - Read the manager notes thoroughly. Experience: 8 years progressive experience in business analysis, systems analysis, testing or other analytical experience. This is a Lead Business Analyst role with strong focus on Digital Products experience Looking for strong Product awareness, exp working in digital products (heavy portal exp). Key: Needs someone who is self-motivated, understands how SAFe works, understands how Product Owner works, general perspective on Product Mgmt, how the Lead BA and Product Manager should work together. Healthcare/Digital Product BG or exp would be ideal Solid analysis skills, go-getter attitude, mindset to get the job done and ability to work with minimal guidance. Certs are great to have (BA or Products certs). Will be writing stories, scope of work, etc... Just like previous roles where she wants a good combo of BA/Product Owner exp. Products are the digital portals... Combo of front-end work or backend work depending on workload. Tool side: Aha! & Jira.. Tech side: Datadog & Google Analytics Interview Process: Phone screen with the Manager (or a team member) followed by a panel interview (technical/product focused). No on-site requirement right now but may transition to once a month or something in future based on need. PI planning sessions mostly. Should be able to go in without any issues. Will be leading tracks of work not necessarily leading people but she be able to share knowledge to folks with less exp. PURPOSE: The Lead Business Analyst will have the responsibility to ensure that the business's need for changes to processes, policies and/or information systems are identified, understood, defined, documented and acted upon by eliciting, analyzing, documenting, validating, specifying and verifying the needs of business or user. The incumbent is accountable for leading the gathering and synthesizing of business requirements for high complexity software, systems, processes and/or services and translating them into specifications ensuring the business objectives are met. Interprets business needs and issues by gathering, eliciting, creating, analyzing, documenting and validating the Business areas user and/or technical (functional/non-functional) requirements. Key contributor in the creation of project plans to define, organize and schedule requirements management and development activities. Provides oversight and strategic direction to lower level analysts which includes coaching, mentoring, and delegating of tasks and deliverables. Facilitates requirements analysis and verification sessions. Accountable in the tracking and management of open issues and assists in planning for resolution. Responsible for successful development sessions and design reviews in order to ensure design meets user requirements.

Hi Team, Please find BA role and share some suitable profiles to vinaykumar@itechstack.com Position: Senior Business Analyst Location: Boston, MA (Day-one Onsite) Job Type: Contract Job Description: Business Requirements Management and Solution Development. Experience in writing and understanding of SQL query. Develop and maintain an understanding of the processes, goals, requirements and issues related to Bright Horizons' operational lines of business and supporting systems including how each is used and how the systems integrate to meet business needs. Identify opportunities to accomplish project goals in the most efficient and cost effective manner. Collaborate with business stakeholders to fully understand, define and document business requirements for software and/or process changes through a variety of means focusing on medium to high complexity projects, processes and functional areas of the applications. Conduct user interviews, surveys, workflow reviews and research on industry best practices and user workshops documenting current (As-Is) and Future (To-Be) scenarios including processes, models, use cases, plans, flow diagrams, requirements write ups and solutions. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Extensive understanding experience on data governance and data initiatives and define Data Retention strategy and objectives while enabling business values. Drive and challenge business users on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans. Proactively identify ways in which system and process changes can improve efficiency of key users, customer service, accuracy of results, and/or completeness of data. Act as a change agent to help ensure that assumptions, development and implementation of new systems/processes enhance the success of the project and increase the project's alignment with the business needs. Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure that requirements are properly translated into technical specifications, clarify requirements, review recommendations and answer questions. Collaborate and build consensus between technical team and stakeholders working to balance scope, speed to market and available resources. Ensure that all processes and documentation are consistent with best practices and Bright Horizons standards for Solution Delivery Life Cycle. Drive the development of a master test plan with the QE team with that traces business requirements throughout the SDLC and ensures that all process steps are followed. Primary Skills Business Requirements Management and Solution Development Secondary Skill SQL, Data Governance #c2c #hotlist #vendorlist #hotlist #businessanalyst

In the world of business analysis, two key roles reign supreme: the BA and the BSA. But what sets them apart? David McDonald, our Director of Development, has the answer: ðŸ’¼ BA - Business Analyst ðŸ’¼ When it comes to the BA, or business analyst, it's all about the front-end functionality. They focus on ensuring a seamless user experience, from start to finish. Whether it's SaaS or PaaS solutions, their goal remains the same: deliver excellence in user interaction. ðŸ’» BSA - Business Systems Analyst ðŸ’» On the other hand, the BSA, or business systems analyst, delves into the backend systems and integrations that power the digital ecosystem. Their realm is all about understanding the business processes and how software can best support them. Whether you're a BA or a BSA, understanding these nuances is essential for success in the ever-evolving digital landscape. #BusinessAnalysis #BusinessSystemsAnalyst #DigitalSolutions #BrillianceBusinessSolutions
